info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:25PM EDT until July 12 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Berkeley.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding may rapidly develop across areas that flooded Friday afternoon across Oakatee, College Park, and Goose Creek. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Ladson, Crowfield Plantation, Wando, College Park, Sangaree and Cote Bas Landing.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING
